1.title: William Rakena
1.plot: Hip hop dancer William Rakena discovers the street-style energy of krump but will he be able to hold his ground in his first ever krump battle?

2.title: JessB
2.plot: Rapper JessB is on the brink of the big time; by delving into her cultural heritage will she find what she needs to take her musical message to the next level?

3.title: Ruby White
3.plot: Foodie Ruby White has set herself the challenge to learn a dish that's been in her Malaysian family for 80 years, but can she master the complicated recipe before her pop-up restaurant?

4.title: Jacob Tamata
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Latayvia Tualasea-Tautai
5.plot: Concerned about the lack of engagement from Pasifika young people in politics, Latayvia attempts to lift up their voices at the launch of new Pasifika youth organization, Labournesia.

6.title: Tina Bonsu Maro
6.plot: Writer Tina will perform at her first spoken word event, but when the topic is identity, can she find an honest connection to both her Ghanaian and Cook Island heritage?

7.title: Noa Wooloff
7.plot: Determined to help other young dads deal with feelings of guilt and shame, teen Dad Noa Wooloff sets out to bring young fathers together, but will anyone show up?

8.title: Ana Downey and Khushee Jain
8.plot: Ana and Khushee must learn to get loud in order to share the importance of sustainability and save the polluted Meola Creek.

1.title: Alice Canton
1.plot: Do I choose to be white? The child of a Chinese and Europe cross-cultural union, actor and playwright Alice Canton creates a work that challenges why our society forces people to choose one ethnic box.

2.title: DJ Lee
2.plot: Korean international student DJ Lee aspires to lead his school Samoan group at Polyfest. He's certainly a great dancer, but will the Samoan community accept this enthusiastic foreigner in a cultural leadership role?

3.title: Malvinder Singh-Bains
3.plot: Neuroscientist Malvindar Singh-Bains attempts to help her Sikh community understand degenerative brain disorders, but is that even possible when the subject of brain donation is still so controversial in her own family?

4.title: Abby Sturgin
4.plot: Miss World NZ finalist Abby Stugin seeks a deeper connection with her Laos heritage, but has always felt rejected by the community. Can she find the connection she craves to allow her the confidence required to win Miss World?

5.title: David Correos
5.plot: Filipino Kiwi David Correos just won New Zealand's most prestigious comedy award, The Billy T. Now he wants to shake up his routine to incorporate more stories from his culture, but will he be able to create a winning routine that doesn't involve him taking off his clothes?

6.title: Ali Thair
6.plot: Iraqi migrant Ali is frustrated with the stereotype of Arabs as terrorists and sets out to create a photography series that will challenge the Kiwi public to look beyond the headlines and to the real people inside the Islamic faith.

7.title: Makuka Musowa
7.plot: Zambian songstress Mukuka Musowa feels isolated from her cultural identity. Can she reconnect and find the confidence to make herself heard in a crowded and highly competitive music industry?

8.title: Simran Sandhu
8.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

9.title: Kartik Swarmi
9.plot: Fijian Indian, Kartik Swarmi overcame a life threatening heart condition to be come a professional wrestler, but if he wants to achieve his next goal of fighting for the WWE he needs to increase his fan base. Will his Fijian-Indian community get behind him?

10.title: Adorate Mizero
10.plot: Burundian Kiwi Adorate Mizero is creating a series of videos to give refugee youth the opportunity to talk honestly about the support systems in place for them. But will she find participants who will openly voice their concerns?

imdb.plot outline: Each week we meet one 18-30 year old who is facing a defining moment in their life, tapping into the unique concerns, hopes and fears this generation faces. Giving the show a 21st century twist, participants use handicams to record their own candid thoughts, feelings and opinions as well as introducing us to their refugee or migrant communities and navigating us through their, at times, contradictory worlds. The series presents a dynamic collection of surprising, funny and poignant personal stories about kiwis either living a culture clash or enjoying the best of both worlds. Prepare to laugh and cry with the unique and familiar in a documentary series that takes minority programming to another level. A switched-on and entertaining show that gives a voice to a vibrant and progressive group of young Kiwis with a foot in Both Worlds.
